channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Fire prompts evacuations at U.N. climate talks in Brazil; 13 suffer smoke inhalation
item.description: Officials say a fire that spread through pavilions being used for U.N. climate talks in Brazil has prompted evacuations on the next-to-last day of the conference.
item.content:encoded:
Officials say a fire that spread through pavilions being used for U.N. climate talks in Brazil has prompted evacuations on the next-to-last day of the conference.

(Image credit: Catherine Ellis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The limitations of trash TV, as seen in 'All's Fair'
item.description: Ryan Murphy's trashy melodrama further cements his parallels with Lee Daniels and Tyler Perry. But even fans of "so bad it's good" trash TV would throw their hands up in agony at Murphy's new show starring Kim Kardashian.
item.content:encoded:
All's Fair.'/>

Ryan Murphy's trashy melodrama further cements his parallels with Lee Daniels and Tyler Perry. But even fans of "so bad it's good" trash TV would throw their hands up in agony at Murphy's new show starring Kim Kardashian.

(Image credit: Ser Baffo)
item.dc:creator: Aisha Harris

item.title: Judge orders an end to Trump's troop deployment in D.C., calling it 'unlawful'
item.description: U.S. District Judge Jia Cobb put a pause on her order until Dec. 11 to allow the Trump administration time to appeal.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. District Judge Jia Cobb put a pause on her order until Dec. 11 to allow the Trump administration time to appeal.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Three is not a crowd: Béla Fleck, Edmar Castañeda and Antonio Sánchez are BEATrio
item.description: Banjo, harp and drums meet in the BEATrio, where Béla Fleck, Edmar Castañeda and Antonio Sánchez explore a sound they never planned to create. Hear how the trio first came together.
item.content:encoded: Banjo, harp and drums meet in the BEATrio, where Béla Fleck, Edmar Castañeda and Antonio Sánchez explore a sound they never planned to create. Hear how the trio first came together.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Geledi

item.title: Recalled baby formula linked to a botulism outbreak may still be in some stores
item.description: A botulism outbreak that has sickened more than two dozen babies in 15 states has been linked to ByHeart formula sold nationwide. Here's what to know about it.
item.content:encoded:
A botulism outbreak that has sickened more than two dozen babies in 15 states has been linked to ByHeart formula sold nationwide. Here's what to know about it.

(Image credit: Cheyanne Mumphrey)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: White House condemns Democratic lawmakers' video but backs off Trump's posts
item.description: The Democratic lawmakers said that members of the military can and must refuse illegal orders by their superiors.
item.content:encoded:
The Democratic lawmakers said that members of the military can and must refuse illegal orders by their superiors.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Saige Miller

item.title: Rosalía and sombr crack the top 10 on the charts for the first time
item.description: Even as sombr and Rosalía hit new career highs, there's a major churn taking place just below the top 10, as a wave of Christmas songs begin their ascent.
item.content:encoded:
Even as sombr and Rosalía hit new career highs, there's a major churn taking place just below the top 10, as a wave of Christmas songs begin their ascent.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola/Getty Images for MTV; Photo by Aldara Zarraoa/WireImage)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: The CDC revives debunked 'link' between childhood vaccines and autism
item.description: A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention webpage that previously stated "Vaccines do not cause autism" has been changed to cast doubt on the scientific research that supports the finding.
item.content:encoded:
A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention webpage that previously stated "Vaccines do not cause autism" has been changed to cast doubt on the scientific research that supports the finding.

(Image credit: Ben Hendren)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: These families' health care costs will balloon if Congress doesn't act on the ACA
item.description: Millions of Americans face sharply rising costs for health care plans they bought through the Affordable Care Act marketplaces, unless Congress acts soon. Here's what's at stake for them.
item.content:encoded:
Millions of Americans face sharply rising costs for health care plans they bought through the Affordable Care Act marketplaces, unless Congress acts soon. Here's what's at stake for them.

(Image credit: Chris O'Donnell, Bixon family, Genna Boatright, Ezra McKay and Kristine Weidner)
item.dc:creator: Carmel Wroth

item.title: 'A Man on the Inside' goes to college, and Ted Danson aces the test
item.description: Charles (Ted Danson) went undercover in a retirement community in the first season of the hit Netflix series. In Season 2, Charles enrolls in college, and brings along a fantastic new cast.
item.content:encoded:
Charles (Ted Danson) went undercover in a retirement community in the first season of the hit Netflix series. In Season 2, Charles enrolls in college, and brings along a fantastic new cast.

(Image credit: Colleen E. Hayes)
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli
